notes: On July 27, LNA airstrikes hit Misratah Air College.

assoc_actor_1: Students (India); JKNC: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference
notes: On July 27, students of Government Higher Secondary School Pancheri along with locals led by NC block president held a protest rally in Udhampur city (Udhampur, J&K) against shortage of teachers in their school. [size=no report]

On 27 July (assumed), over a 100 students from the Lord Mahavira Homoeopathic Medical College and their principal demonstrated on the road in Ludhiana city (Punjab) to oppose the unloading of waste near the girl's hostel. [size=over 100]

On 27 July, students of Government Rajindra College demonstrated in Bathinda city (Punjab) to oppose the charging of PTA fund from SC students. The report suggest that the students became violent towards council members and some students were manhandled and thrown into the road. No injuries were reported. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On July 26 2019, 1 civilian was arrested during a raid by Afghan and NATO forces on civilian compounds in the Karezak area of Qala i Kah (Pusht Koh) district, Farah. 1 house, 1 school, and 1 mosque were burned.
On 23 July, 2019, students held their 22nd consecutive anti-regime university demonstrations in Oran [size= no report].
On July 26th, college students demonstrated in Kitgum (Kitgum district), throwing stones at teachers and damaging school property. [size=no report]

On July 26, students of Dhaka university pulled down the temporary wall for fencing the station construction site of Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) line-6 in Shahbagh, Dhaka city. Students demanded shifting of the station from the campus. [size=12]

As reported on July 26, rioters vandalized the office properties of the Principal of Maskeliya-Fairlawn Tamil School under the Hatton Zonal Education office in Maskeliya locality (Ambagamuwa, Nuwara Eliya district). The initial investigation reveal that two students vandalized the office to steal test questions. [size=no report]
On 26 July, members of All Assam Students Union staged a protest Golaghat city (Assam) against the decision of the government to shutdown Golaghat Engineering College. [size=no report]

On July 26, Mid Day Meal workers protested at Government Model Higher Secondary School in Ramnagar town (Udhampur, J&K) against Education Department demanding a raise in their remuneration. [size=scores]

On July 26, locals and students from Government Higher Secondary School in Battal Balian protested in Udhampur city (Udhampur, J&K) demanding posting of adequate staffs and provision of better facilities for the school. [size=no report]
On July 26, parents protested and locked Government Primary School Baniyan Wali in Kala Ban town (Poonch, J&K) against the unavailability of teachers in the school. [size=no report]

On July 26, parents of school children blocked the college road and protested in front of DC Office in Kathua city (Kathua, J&K) against the District Administration over its decision to ban public transport vehicles including buses, mini buses and van from plying school children. [size=large]

On 26 July, members of the Ambedkar Students' Association demonstrated at the Panjab University and submitted a memorandum to the VC in Chandigarh city (Chandigarh) to demand the opening of canteens. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: SFI: Students Federation of India; AISA: All India Students Association; Students (India)
notes: On 26 July, student groups including the SFI and AISA demonstrated outside the Delhi University's central library in New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) to demand round the clock access to the library. Security personnel dragged students and snatched their banners; no injuries were reported. [size=no report]
On 25 July 2019, workers of Jordanian University hospital protested against the delay in payment of bonuses, in Amman city. [size=no report]

25 July. Thousands of demonstrators marched from Mnjili Community Day Secondary School to M'mbelwa District Council offices in Mzimba where they presented a petition calling for the resignation of Malawi Electoral Commission (MEC) chairperson Jane Ansah for allegedly mishandling the May 21 Tripartite Elections. The police fired tear gas at the demonstrators. Demonstrators threw bricks and wood at the police, broke shop windows, and blocked roads with burning tires. [size=1000].

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Nigeria); ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities
notes: 25 July. Members of ASUU at the Amrbose Alli University in Ekpoma demonstrated against the suspension of its executive members. [size=no report]

25 July. Students at the University in Osogbo went on rampage and blocked a highway to demonstrate against the arrest of 35 fellow students. Police forces dispersed the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On July 25th, students from two secondary schools in Mbale (Mbale district) clashed following escalating disputes. Police fired teargas at the students, causing 50 hospitalizations, mostly of female students. [size=dozens]
On July 25, rioting activists of BCL attacked a student of Chittagong university on campus (Chittagong city) on the suspicion of being an activist of Shibbir. [size=10-12]

On 25 July, students from various schools staged a protest by forming human chain in Kakwa locality of Imphal (Imphal West district, Manipur) demanding justice for Babysana who had died at the hostel of Standard Robarth Higher Secondary School. [size=no report].

On 25 July, students of St. Patrick English School staged a protest in Thangmeiband Meisnam Leikai locality in Imphal city (Manipur) demanding justice for Babysana who had died at the hostel of Standard Robarth Higher Secondary School. [size=no report].

On 25 July, students from various schools staged a protest by forming human chain in Canchipur town of Kitna Panung (Imphal West district, Manipur) demanding justice for Babysana who had died at the hostel of Standard Robarth Higher Secondary School. [size=no report].
On 25 July, university students and samithi members staged a protest at the Central university in Anantapur city (Andhra Pradesh) against the lack of facilities at the university. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: AISF: All India Students Federation; Students (India)
notes: On 25 July, over 50 members of AISF staged a protest in front of the Government Arts College in Salem city (Tamil Nadu) condemning the National Educational Policy (NEP). [size=50]

On 25 July, UDF members staged a demonstration by blocking all entry points to the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram city (Kerala). The protesters' demands included judicial inquiry into the University College issue and CBI probe into the alleged irregularities in the functioning of Kerala Public Service Commission, along with the issues of the price rise, power tariff hike, police excesses and the decision to scrap the Karunya Benevolent Fund. [size=no report]

On 25 July, Urdu college students staged a protest at the premises of the college in Vijayawada town (Krishna district, Andhra Pradesh) demanding that the State government shift them to the new Urdu Junior College that was built at Kabela centre in the city. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On July 25, members of ABVP protested outside Jammu University campus in Jammu city (Jammu, J&K) demanding introduction of Sanskrit in higher secondary schools and colleges of the state. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: PML-N: Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz; PPP: Pakistan Peoples Party; JUI-F: Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazl; ANP: Awami National Party
notes: On July 25, on call from a grand opposition alliance comprising of PML-N, PPP, JUI-F, ANP and others, local JUI-F and PML-N leaders and supporters held a protest rally at University Chowk in Bahawalpur city (Bahawalpur, Punjab) to mark a 'black day' against PTI government and the alleged rigging during last year's general elections. [size=hundreds]

As reported on July 25, applicants of Balochistan's three medical colleges held a protest rally culminating in a sit-in at Hockey Chowk in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan) against the delay in publishing admission merit list. [size=large]

A public school principal and his sister, an official of the Department of Education, were shot and killed by unidentified assailants at Barangay Hibaiyo, Guihulngan City, Negros Oriental province on July 25, 2019.

On July 25, about a dozen students and their parents took part in a protest in the village of Desyatovo against the plans to close down the local school and transfer the students to a larger facility about 20 kilometres away. [size=about a dozen]
24 July. University of Liberia students protested over delayed faculty salaries in Monrovia near Capitol Hill. Police intervened by forming a human barricade. [size=hundreds]

actor2: Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Special Anti-Robbery Squad
notes: 24 July. An attempted arrest of a student on a University campus in Ijebu-Ode sparked a street-fight between Police SARS forces and students. Police fired warning shots to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Students (South Africa); SASCO: South Africa Students Congress
notes: 24 July. Students, led by the South African Students Congress, demonstrated at the University of KwaZulu-Natal Westville campus ON Tuesday. Clashes between the demonstrators, university security, and Police Public Order Unites have been reported. The demonstration was over the financial exclusion of some students, delayed National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) payments and meal allowances. [size=500].
24 July. Students from Atwell Madala High School in Mthatha demonstrated at the school, demanding a new school. [size=1700].

assoc_actor_1: Students (South Africa); SASCO: South Africa Students Congress
notes: 24 July. Students of Port Elizabeth TVET College, led by the South African Students Congress (SASCO), marched to Humewood Police Station to open a case of fraud against the National Students Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS). The students claim that NSFAS deducts payments for no reason. [size=100].

On July 24, two students of Dhaka university were beaten on campus (Shahbagh, Dhaka city) by activists of BCL for joining protests at Dhaka university demanding an end to affiliation of seven government colleges with the university. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Students (Sri Lanka); Sinhalese Ethnic Group (Sri Lanka)
notes: On July 24, a clash ensued between two groups of students of the Faculty of Engineering of the University of Jaffna in Araviyar Nagar of Kilinochchi town (Karachchi, Kilinochchi district). Several students, including Sinhalese students, were injured and hospitalized following the incident. [size=no report]

On 24 July, students, local residents and women staged a protest at DM College in Dewlahland locality of Porompat (Imphal East district, Imphal East) demanding the government to arrest all those involved in the mysterious death of Babysana. [size=no report].

On 24 July, members of Mairembam Leikai Youth Club and College Gate Apunba Nupi Lup Moirang staged a protest in Moirang city (Bishnupur district, Manipur) demanding the government to arrest all those involved in the mysterious death of Babysana. [size=no report]

On 24 July, TMC student leaders beat up a college teacher in Konnagar town of Serampur Uttarpara (Hooghly district, West Bengal) for interfering in the affairs of the students' union. [size=no report]

On 24 July, students from the National University of Law started an indefinite protest and staged a demonstration in Cuttack (Cuttack, Odisha), demanding improvement of campus placement, construction of a library and renovation of the girls' hostel. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On July 24, Indian troops allegedly assaulted and injured several Central University of Kashmir (CUK) students at their hostel in Ganderbal town (Ganderbal, J&K) when the students objected to a raid by the troops allegedly conducted without any official procedure at their hostel.

On July 24, members of Nepal Student Union protested by padlocking the residence of the registrar of Sudhurpaschim University near Bhimdatta area (Kanchanpur district, Mahakali). The students were expressing dissatisfaction with the authorities for not fulfilling various demands put forth by their union, including not conducting a hearing on the appointment of the registrar and the vice chair of the university. [size=no report]

On July 24, female students of Royal College blocked Narowal-Shakargarh road outside the District Jail in Narowal city (Narowal, Punjab) against a police official over allegedly assaulting a driver belonging to their college. [size=no report]

source: Voice of Jihad; New York Times
notes: On July 23 2019, 1 civilian, a high school teacher, was killed and 2 children were wounded by a rocket fired by Afghan forces from a helicopter in the Joy Ganj area of Murghab district, Badghis.

24 July. Students from Mariannridge Secondary School in Pinetown set a classroom on fire during a demonstration over broken toilets that have not been repaired on Tuesday. Students and parents demonstrated at the school the following day. [size=no report].

On 23 July, relatives of a girl who had died hit by a school bus staged a protest in Urkondapeta village of Urkonda Mandal (Nagarkurnool district, Telangana) alleging that she had been killed due to the driver's negligence, and demanded justice. [size=no report]

On 23 July, local residents staged a protest by blocking the road in Thangmeiband Meisnam Leikai of Dewlahland in Imphal city (Manipur) demanding justice for Babysana who had died at the hostel of Standard Robarth Higher Secondary School. [size=no report]

On 23 July, local residents (mostly women) staged a protest by blocking road in Thangal Bazar locality of Imphal (Imphal West district, Manipur) demanding justice for Babysana who had died at the hostel of Standard Robarth Higher Secondary School. [size=no report]

On 23 July, huge numbers of student volunteers, including women, staged protests in various places of Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur) demanding justice for Babysana who had died at the hostel of Standard Robarth Higher Secondary School. [size=huge numbers].

On 23 July, students and teachers of Bhairodan Maxwell Hindi Primary School staged a protest in Imphal city (Imphal West district, Manipur) against denouncing the amalgamation of the mentioned school. [size=no report]

On 23 July, students, led by AMSU, staged a protest in Imphal (Imphal West district, Manipur) demanding justice for Babysana who had died at the hostel of Standard Robarth Higher Secondary School. [size=no report]

On 23 July, CPI leaders were injured in the police lathi charge when they were staging a protest march in Kochi town (Ernakulam district, Kerala) against the police supporting SFI activists, who beat up AISF students at Vypin Government Arts And Science College on Monday. [size=group]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 23 July, ABVP members demonstrated outside the offices of 5 HODs on the premises of Delhi University in New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) to demand the prompt finalisation of the syllabi. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 23 July, approximately 100 students including members of the ABVP demonstrated at the Lajpat Rai College in Ghaziabad city (Uttar Pradesh) to oppose the denial of admission to some students named in the cut-off list. [size=100]

assoc_actor_1: AISA: All India Students Association; SFI: Students Federation of India; Students (India)
notes: On 23 July, members of the AISA, SFI and other students unions demonstrated at the Delhi University in New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) to oppose the interference of the ABVP in the varsity syllabus. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: NSUI: National Students Union of India; Students (India)
notes: On 23 July, NSUI members demonstrated at Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University in Agra city (Uttar Pradesh) to demand action against security guards who assaulted students on protest. The police used mild force to disperse demonstrators; no injuries reported. [size=no report]
On July 23, locals from Jabbal Chutto village protested outside Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh) demanding opening of a new school in their area. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Students (Greece); Teachers (Greece); KNE: Communist Youth of Greece
notes: On 23 July, dozens of students, teachers and members of political parties of the left not represented in Parliament marched in central Athens to protest against the abolition of a law banning police from entering university grounds. Members of KNE held a separate parallel march. The new legislation is being introduced by the recently elected centre-right government to allow police to respond to complaints of violence or crime on campuses. [size=dozens]

On 23 July, members of the student union Socialist Student Struggle rallied in Kamara in central Thessaloniki to protest against the abolition of a law banning police from entering university grounds. The new legislation is being introduced by the recently elected centre-right government to allow police to respond to complaints of violence or crime on campuses. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2012-) Security Belt Forces
notes: On July 22, Security Belt forces reportedly defused an explosive devise of unknown origin next to Al-Khala school, located around 350m north of Al-'Aqil roundabout in Khur Maksar district of Aden port city, the country's interim capital in southwestern Yemen, with no report of fatalities nor injuries.
On 22/7/2019, about 30 staff of Azad University in Parand against unpaid salaries. [size=approximately 30]

22 July. Police have arrested one student at the Durban University of Technology for public violence during a demonstration. The demonstrating students and security guards from the university clashed during the demonstration. Police used stun grenades and teargas to disperse the crowd. The demonstration was over issues with residences, students being blocked on the NSFAS funding system and a lack of safety on the campus. [Size=150].
22 July. Demonstrations were reported at the Howard College at the University of KwaZulu-Natal. [size=no report].
On July 22nd, students at the University of Khartoum commemorated the June 3rd massacre, and called for a civilian govt and a fair investigation into the causes of the massacre. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Syria (2000-) Syrian Arab Air Force
notes: On 22 July 2019, regime warplanes carried out airstrikes on Kafruma in Idleb in conjunction with the dropping of barrel bombs by regime helicopters on Western Al Farouk schools, which resulted in the killing of 2 people.

On 22 July, students of the College of Horticulture in Chiplima (Sambalpur, Odisha) staged protest in front of their college demanding 100% reservation in recruitment to the post of Assistant Horticulture Officer (AHO). [size=no report]

On 22 July, students staged a protest in Canchipur town of Kitna Panung (Imphal West district, Manipur) demanding justice for Babysana who had died at the hostel of Standard Robarth Higher Secondary School. [size=no report].

On 22 July, supported by CPI(M) victims of the Keshava Reddy deposit fraud staged protests at Collectorate and Keshava Reddy school in Kurnool city (Andhra Pradesh) demanding that the Chief Minister provide relief to them. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: SFI: Students Federation of India; Students (India)
assoc_actor_2: AISF: All India Students Federation; Students (India)

As reported on 22 July, workers from Congress party, Vijaypur constituency, protested before the office of Sub Divisional Magistrate in Vijaypur town (Samba, J&K) demanding change of proposed site for the construction of a degree college from Tarore village to area close to Vijaypur town. [size=no report]

On 22 July, approximately 200 members of Sikh religious bodies were lathicharged by the police behind the Punjab School Education Board premises in Mohali city (Sahibzada Ajit Singh Nagar, Punjab) as they demonstrated against the CBI's closure report in the Bargari case. Six demonstrators were injured. [size=200]

On 22 July, relatives of a student who was sodomised by other students, blocked the Kaithal road outside the school in Karnal city (Haryana) to oppose the inaction by the school management. [size=no report]

On 22 July (assumed), approximately 30 students demonstrated at the Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University in Agra city (Uttar Pradesh) to oppose the irregularities in evaluation of answer sheets and the delay in the declaration of results. Demonstrators were assaulted by the varsity security guards; no injuries reported. [size=30]

On July 22, parents protested by padlocking Nepal National Basic School in Karmarong Rural Municipality-9 in Mugu area (Mugu district, Karnali). The protesters were expressing dissatisfaction with the teachers for staying absent for a long time. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Manobo Ethnic Group (Philippines); Lumad Ethnic Group (Philippines)
notes: Manobo and Lumad protesters held a demonstration at Davao City, Davao del Sur province on July 22, 2019, the day of the President's State of the Nation speech. They criticized the government for shutting down the schools of indigenous people. [size=no report]
On 21/7/2019, a group of contractual staff of Gachsaran Oil and Gas University protested against forced unpaid leave, outside the headquarters of the district governor in Dogonbadan. [size=no report]

On July 21st, academics protested outside of the Sudan University for Science and Technology (Khartoum), demanding the resignation of the director and for a free union to be established. [size=no report]

On July 21, students of Dhaka university staged a protest demonstration on the gate of campus (Shahbagh, Dhaka city) demanding cancellation of seven colleges' affiliation with the university. [size=no report]
On July 21, locals from Moghla area protested at the main market in Moghla of Kalakot tehsil (Rajouri, J&K) demanding setting up of Degree College in Moghla. [size=no report]
On 21 July, a bomb exploded near the boundary wall of a private school in Bangain village (Gonda, Uttar Pradesh). No injuries were reported.

On July 21, under the banner of All Sindh Universities Employees Federation, employees from public sector universities of Sindh province protested in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh) against pay cuts and harassment of colleagues by Mehran University of Engineering and Technology (MUET) administration, and demanded release of withheld salaries. [size=no report]

On 20 July, anti-Houthi National Resistance Forces reportedly fired artillery at a school and at surrounding houses in Ad Durayhimi city, southeast of Al Hudaydah city, western Yemen. No fatalities nor injuries reported.

assoc_actor_1: ABFSU: All Burma Federation of Student Unions; Students (Myanmar)
source: BBC News; Radio Free Asia; VOA

Students demanded the immediate release of the arrested students who rallied on 7th July at the university and the abolition of the oppressive student housing rules. [size=20]

source: Asian News International; India Blooms News Service; Orissa TV
notes: On 20 July, a bomb explosion took place inside a school premises in Magura village (Ganjam district, Odisha) and at least two students were critically injured. A student picked up a package which exploded. The reason behind the explosion is under investigation.

[size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)

On 20 July, students of the Government High School and a councillor demonstrated in front of the school in Chandigarh city (Chandigarh) to demand that the transferring of students be postponed until the receiving school has basic amenities. [size=no report]

On 20 July, farmers and Congress workers demonstrated in Rampur city (Uttar Pradesh) to oppose the encroachment of land by the Jauhar University. The demonstrators tried to reach the gate of the university but were stopped by the police. [size=no report].
On 20 July, in Niem, a director of the private Catholic school of Niem-Yelewa was murdered by unidentified armed group.
On July 20, a BCL leader was shot in the leg by unidentified assailants at Dhaka university (Shahbagh, Dhaka city). Police has yet not shared the details of incident.

On July 20, students of Gonoshasthaya Samaj Vittik Medical College staged a protest demonstration on campus (Savar, Dhaka) demanding registration under Bangladesh Medical and Dental Council (BMDC) and educational activities under Dhaka University. [size=400]

On July 20, students of Dhaka university staged a protest demonstration on campus (Shahbagh, Dhaka city) against a move to demolish the Teachers-Students Center wall of the university. [size=no report]

On July 19 2019, at least 10 civilians were killed and several wounded by a suicide car bombing close to Kabul University in Kabul city. The government blamed the Taliban, who denied responsibility. Fatalities coded as 11 to include the bomber.

On July 19, members of Dogra Students Scholars Forum (DSSF) held a protest at the main gate of the Jammu University in Jammu city (Jammu, J&K) against the Higher Education Department for ignoring Dogri language in all upgraded higher secondary schools. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: ND: New Democracy; Police Forces of Greece (2015-2019)
notes: On 20 May, ahead of the Supreme Court convening the following day regarding the furlough of hunger-striking Dimitris Koufodinas, his supporters targeted campaign offices of opposition party New Democracy in Alimos and in Nea Ionia in Athens breaking windows and setting them on fire with homemade explosive devices; they also smashed ATMs and later in the day set off from three university campuses to move dumpsters on Patission street in central Athens to set them on fire. The most serious incident occurred at the Athens University of Economics and Business involving 20 hooded individuals. Police detained 20 people that were released later except for two migrants that were arrested for not having the necessary permits to be in the country. No injuries were reported. [size=at least 20]

On 7 March, tens of students and professors of the Bucharest University protested against governmental decrees limiting judicial independence.

On 6 March 2019, farmers and students staged a demonstration march from Halu Oleo University to the governor's office in Kendari city, Southeast Sulawesi province, to protest against the mining activity on the island of Wawonii. They managed to get into the courtyard of the building and the police responded by firing tear gas into the crowd, scattering the demonstrators. A video showed officers chasing down and thrashing a young demonstrator with iron rods. The total injured included four policemen, four students and three farmers from Wawonii. [size=no report]
06 March. Students from the Saldanha Bay high school, Cape Town, protested against teachers who conduct classes in Afrikaans. [size=300].

source: African News Agency; Citizen (South Africa); GroundUp
notes: 06 March. Parents and students staged from Sandisulwazi Secondary School, Paterson, staged a protest over the shortage of teachers at the school. The N10 road was blocked with burning rubble. Members of the Public Order Police (POPs) unit was deployed to disperse the crowd. [size=300].

assoc_actor_1: Students (South Africa); SASCO: South Africa Students Congress
notes: 07 March. Students, led by SASCO, at the Nelson Mandela Bay University, Port Elizabeth, blocked all entrances of the campus with rocks and branches in protest over students not being able to register due to financial constraints. [size=400].
On March 6th, academics working for El Ahliya University in Omdurman staged an anti-government protest, amidst nationwide demonstrations. [size=no report]

On March 6 2019, professors and members of the teaching staff of the Public University in Beirut held a demonstration in Riad al Solh Square in Beirut to demand a salary scale implementation as well as increased pensions. [size=no report]

On March 6, students and the members of IHH staged a protest in Ataturk University in Erzurum city and condemned the execution of nine men in Egypt following their reportedly unfair trial for the killing of the former Public Prosecutor of the country. [size=no report]

On March 6, the inter-university students organized a protest march in Colombo city against the allegations levelled at them over the ragging acts on freshman students at the Wayamba University of Sri Lanka. The road from Maradana to Technical College Junction has been blocked. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: INSO: India National Students' Organisation; Students (India)
notes: On 6 March, a man was shot dead and three others injured in Sector 49 in Chandigarh city (Chandigarh) by unidentified persons. The attack is believed to be connected to a rivalry over control of the Indian National Student Organisation at DAV College.

On 6 March, over 100 contractual clerks shouted slogans against the university as part of an ongoing agitation on the campus of the Punjabi University in Patiala (Punjab). Four clerks also commenced a hunger strike to press their demand for promotion to 'ad-hoc employees'. [size=over 100]

assoc_actor_1: NSUI: National Students Union of India; Students (India)
notes: On 6 March, NSUI activists demonstrated on the Delhi University campus in Timarpur (NCT of Delhi) to oppose the rising unemployment in the country and the alleged false promises made by the government. [size=no report]

On 6 March, members of the Jawaharlal Nehru University Teachers' Association demonstrated on campus in Mehrauli (NCT of Delhi) to oppose the administration's decision to restrict protest areas. [size=no report]

On 6 Mar, in Guntur district (AP), the Guntur Medical College Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) students staged protest for an hour demanding the Medical Council of India (MCI) to recognize their degrees. They attended to their duties after the protest. Protest still ongoing as of 7 Mar. Day 1 [size=no report]

On 6 Mar, in Kozhikode (Kozhikode, Kerala), a principal of the Government Medical College, including security staff, was assaulted by a Medical College Students' Union chairman and members during a demonstration on campus, demanding the principal to correct the minutes of a meeting which portrayed a particular session on the campus as "anti-national." Students denied the allegations. [size=no report]

On 6 Mar, in Coimbatore (Coimbatore, TN), faculty members of the Government Arts College staged a sit-in protest against the State Government's move to transfer lecturers and professors for their participation in the indefinite strike called for by the JACTTO-GEO union. [size=100]

On 6 Mar, in Hyderabad (Hyderabad, Telangana), students staged a protest in the campus of Government Nizamia Tibbi College in Charminar, alleging lack of necessary faculty and improper handling of practical examinations which caused most of them to fail the exams. [size=no report]

On 06 March, students of Magadh University burnt a Bihar State Road Transport bus in Gaya town (Bihar) during a demonstration against the delay in declaration of graduation results even after six months of examinations. Police used force to disperse the rioters. [size=no report]

On 06 March, a government-run residential school was closed down by parents and guardians of students at Udala (Mayurbhanj, Odisha) protesting against the impregnation of a girl student. [size=no report]

On 6 March 2019, a group of 22 families of tenants, including school children, who were evicted from the Taman Manggis people's housing project staged a demonstration in front of the project and then marched to Komtar in George Town, Northeast Penang Island, Penang state, to hand a memorandum to the Penang Chief Minister's office to protest their eviction. [size=22 families]

On 6 March 2019, a group of 22 families of tenants, including school children, who were evicted from the Taman Manggis people's housing project staged a demonstration in front of the project in Bukit Mertajam city, Central Seberang Perai district, Penang state. The demonstration became confrontational when officers from the state housing department came to seal the units and the tenants tried to stop the officers by blocking the entrances. Some of the residents were arrested for the disturbance. [size=22 families]

Property seizure: On March 6, reportedly in a bid to crackdown proscribed organizations under the National Action Plan (NAP), the government agencies took over 31 schools, 16 madrassahs and 9 hospitals belonging to Jamaat-ud-Dawa (JuD) and Falah-i-Insaniyat (FIF) from Karachi, Hyderabad, Matiari, Jamshoro, Mirpukhas, Sanghar, Tando Allahyar, Badin, Tharparkar and other area of Sindh province (provincial capital coded) (Karachi, Sindh).

Property seizure: On March 6, government and law enforcement agencies took control over offices, schools and seminaries belonging to JUD and FIF in Quetta, Pishin, Chaman and Hub area of Balochistan province (provincial capital coded) (Quetta, Balochistan).

On March 6, students of MA journalism and mass communication staged a demonstration and kept their teachers confined in Jadavpur University, in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal), alleging anomaly in evaluation of answer scripts. [size=no report]
Between 1 March to 10 March, employees of the Adarsh Government School in Moga district (Punjab) demonstrated against the non-payment of their salary for eight months. [size=no report]
On 05 March, 2019, students in Bouira protested against Bouteflika's bid for a fifth term on the Akli Mouhand Oulhadj University [size=approximately 1,000].
On 05 March, 2019, university professors in Tizi Ouzou took part in a protest to reject Bouteflika's fifth bid [size=no report].
05 March. Ambazonian separatists kidnap 3 students from Bamenda University in Bamenda of Mezam, releasing them 2 days later.

assoc_actor_1: SYNAPAUC: National Union of Support Staff of State Universities of Cameroon; Labour Group (Cameroon)
notes: 05 March. As part of a nationwide strike, SYNAPAUC union protests at University of Douala of Wouri, demanding better working conditions and higher salaries. [size=dozens]

On March 5, dentist students in Sebha staged a protest, demanding that the university administration reconsiders the planned examination dates and adopt the previous examination schedule. [size=no report].

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Sudan); Lawyers (Sudan); Journalists (Sudan); Labour Group (Sudan); Students (Sudan)
notes: On March 5th, strikes occurred in Khartoum, Gadref, White Nile and Kassala states. A number of labour groups - including lawyers, pharmacists, doctors (many of whom have already been engaged in a partial strike), journalists and high-skilled private sector companies - participated in the strike, with Khartoum reportedly coming close to dead-city levels of general inactivity. Secondary school students also joined the strike in Omdurman and one location in the Nuba Mountains.

On March 5 2019, approximately 50 Israeli Settlers from the Yitzhar Settlement attacked a school in Urif, in the northern occupied West Bank district of Nablus. Israeli Settlers threw rocks which injured one student and damaged three vehicles. The school was forced to dismiss classes for the 11th time this year. [size=about 50]
On March 5 2019, students demonstrated in front of the Ministry of Education in Irbid city against the newly imposed single-semester system for tawjihi (Senior-Highschool) students. [size=dozens]

On Mar 5, students of Jagannath University vandalized a police van after a scuffle broke-out between students and police personnel following beating of a student by police in Tatipara area (Sutrapur, Dhaka). Several people were hurt in the clash. [size=no report]

On 5 March, hundreds of students of Punjab Agricultural University in Ludhiana city (Punjab) resumed their demonstration for the 14th day against the university and launched an indefinite chain hunger strike to press for a series of demands including allowing student's cars entry on campus. Five students sat on dharna and participated in the first day of the hunger strike. [size=hundreds]

On 5 March, students demonstrated at the BHU gate in Varanasi city (Uttar Pradesh) as part of the 'Bharat bandh' called by several organisations to oppose the UGC's 13-point roster and eviction of tribal people from the forest. The students demanded a law that reserves 49.5% of appointments at the university. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 5 March, members of the ABVP demonstrated against Delhi University's Vice-Chancellor in Timarpur (NCT of Delhi) for his failures to implement student's demands. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: SFI: Students Federation of India; Students (India)
notes: Assumed on 5 Mar, in Hyderabad (Hyderabad, Telangana), during a country-wide bandh called by students against the University Grants Commission's (UGC) 13-point roster system on faculty recruitment, the Ambedkar Students Association of the University of Hyderabad, including the SFI, held a protest at the campus. [size=no report]

On 5 Mar, in Hyderabad (Hyderabad, Telangana), Osmania University (OU) students staged a protest in front of the BC Study Circle condemning the delays in giving scholarships, study materials, and books to the students selected for training. [size=no report]

On 05 March, road and rail traffic was disrupted in Bihar state with the exception of Patna city during the Bharat bandh called by some social organisations to protest against University Grant Commission's 13-point roster system for appointment of teachers in colleges and universities, Centre's Citizenship (Amendment) Bill and 10% reservation for economically weaker sections. [size=no report]

On 05 March, road and rail traffic was disrupted in Bihar state including Vaishali district (Bihar) during the Bharat bandh called by some social organisations to protest against University Grant Commission's 13-point roster system for appointment of teachers in colleges and universities, Centre's Citizenship (Amendment) Bill and 10% reservation for economically weaker sections. [size=no report]

On 05 March, parents of Global Indian International School staged a protest outside the school located at Gota, Ahmedabad city (Gujarat) for violating the order of the Fee Regulatory Committee (FRC). [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 05 March, members of Akhil Bhartiya Vidyarthi Parishad held a protest in Ranchi city (Jharkhand) against a missionary institution Ursuline Intermediate College for sending students in Rahul Gandhi's rally. [size=25]

On March 5, members of the Rajiv Gandhi University Students' Union (RGUSU), RGU Research Scholars' Forum (RGURSF) and RGU Teachers' Association (RGUTA) staged a protest and campus shutdown in Rono city (Papum Pare, Arunachal Pradesh), in support of a Bharat Bandh called by several tribal outfits against University Grants Commission's new 13-point system that will cut jobs for SCs, STs, and the OBCs. [size=no report]

On 5 Mar, local residents, including students, staged a protest in Turtuk town (J&K), demanding the reinstatement of an earlier decision to establish a government degree college in the area. [size=massive]

05 March. An unidentified armed group attacks the Cameroon College of Arts and Sciences in Kumba of Ekondo Titi. Staff and students are required to leave the campus but no reports of civilian casualties.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 March 2019. Police and soldiers shot and killed a man in Cibanda, Mwenga (coordinates for Cibanda school used prec1), after he resisted arrest. The security forces injured five other youth.

Lumad protesters and groups like Save Our Schools Mindanao and Kasalo-CARAGA marched to various government offices Manila, Metro Manila on March 5, 2019. They were protesting the Supreme Court's decision to extend martial law throughout Mindanao as well as the supposed intervention of the United States in Philippine affairs. [size= no report]
On 04 March, 2019, students in Bouira protested against Bouteflika's bid for a fifth term on the Akli Mouhand Oulhadj University [size=hundreds].

On March 4, in Marcory, a group of students and people armed with machetes prevented some Isfop and Loko students from accessing their schools. Some were reportedly beaten and their phones stolen. [size=no report]

On March 4, in Bouake, in the morning students blocked the international road linking Bouake to Abidjan, protesting against the ongoing strike in the education sector, that has led to an interruption of most public schools. [size=no report]

On March 4, in Koumassi, a group of highschool students, helped with other young people from the area, forced Bad middleschool students and Modern Highschool students to leave their classes, throwing rocks at them. Rioters protested against the national strike in the public education sector which has led to an interruption of most public schools. Police Forces interfered to disperse them. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: SASCO: South Africa Students Congress; Students (South Africa)
notes: 04 March. Students at the Stellenbosch University, led by SASCO, held a demonstration to pressure university management to scrap a proposed ZAR9 bus fare increase. [size=no report].

04 March. Students, led by the Student Representative Council, from the University of South Africa's Durban campus marched in protest over National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) allowances and the postponement of examinations. [size=100].

04 March. Students protested at the Tshwane University of Technology (TUT) in protest against NSFAS-funded meal allowances for off-campus students. Tyres were set alight. Police used stun grenades to disperse the students [size=no report].
04 March. Students from the University of Mpumalanga blocked the entrances of the campus with burning tyres in protest over the increase of off-campus accommodation. [size=no report].

On March 4th, students staged a sit-in protest at the National University in Khartoum, whilst eployees of the NewTech firm also demonstrated. Both demonstrations were against the government, amidst nationwide protests. [size=no report]

On 4 March 2019, a number of teachers and parents of students at a private elementary school in Sidi Bouzid held a protest in front of the school premises to denounce the entrance of the security forces in the school and the arrest of its director. [size=several]

On March 4th, students burnt down parts of a school at an unspecified location in Koro sub-district (Omoro district), in protest at the removal of three staff members, and inadequate rations. Seven students were subsequently arrested.

On March 4 2019, clashes broke out between Palestinians and Israeli forces near Al-Quds University in Abu Dis town. Palestinians threw stones at Israeli soldiers. No injuries were reported. [size=no report]
On Mar 4, students of Jahangirnagar University (Savar, Dhaka) besieged the central library and staged a sit-in protesting against authorities' decision to not allow bags in library. [size=300]

On Mar 4, students of Sheikh Hasina Medical College in Jamalpur town (Mymensingh), formed a human chain on the college campus, boycotting their classes for the third consecutive day demanding arrest and punishment of two local youths who assaulted two students of the college earlier. [size=no report]

On 04 March, teachers of 104 unaided Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) schools protested outside Matoshree, the residence of Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray in Mumbai city (Maharashtra). The protestors are demanding the civic body should provide financial aid to these schools. [size=no report]
On 4 Mar, locals staged a protest at Ramgarh town (Samba, J&K) against the district administration over the decision to build a government degree college in a different location. [size=large number]

On 4 Mar, locals staged a protest at Marheen town (Kathua, J&K) over the government's decision to lay the foundation stone for a degree college serving the area in a village 10km from Marheen town. [size=no report]

On March 4, retired officers and staffs of Sindh Agriculture University Tando Jam staged a protest and a sit-in outside the vice chancellor's office in Tando Jam town (Hyderabad, Sindh), against the university administration demanding payment of their outstanding pensions and other dues. [size=no report]

On March 4, under the leadership of Sindh Student's Council (SSC), students from Mehran University, Sindh University, Liaqat University of Medical and Health Sciences (LUMHS) and Sindh Agriculture University Tando Jam held a rally and staged a protest outside Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh), demanding restoration of student unions. [size=large]

On March 4, students and teachers of Government Girls Degree College Larkana held a rally culminating at a press club in Jinnah Bagh, Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh), to express solidarity with Pakistan Army. [size=no report]

On March 3rd, demonstrations took place in Greater Khartoum (coded as three events in Khartoum, Khartoum North and Omdurman) as part of nationwide anti-govt protests. A sit-in was also staged at an unspecified university [size=no report]

On March 3 2019, a group of 11th graders held a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Education against the newly imposed single-semester system for tawjihi (Senior-Highschool) students. [size=no report]

On March 3 2019, hundreds of students demonstrated in different locations throughout the Karak province against the newly imposed single-semester system for tawjihi (Senior-Highschool) students. [size=hundreds]

On March 3, a group of students from Istanbul University staged a protest to commemorate a murdered student by gathering in Beyazit Campus of the university in Fatih, Istanbul. Police forces intervened and detained 17 students. [size=no report]
On Mar 3, officials of Islamic University staged a protest demonstration at campus in Kushtia, Khulna, demanding increase in salary and retirement age for the officials. [size=300]

On March 3, a clash took place between old boys of St. Peter's College and St. Joseph's College on the final day of their annual big match at the P Sara Oval in Colombo city. At least four spectators were injured. In the commotion a fire cracker exploded among the crowd. [size=no report]
On 3 Mar, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), government college teachers staged a hunger strike demanding annulment of transfer orders of teachers who participated in the JACTTO-GEO protests. [size=400]

On March 2, Government Medical College employees boycotted work and held a demonstration rally in Amritsar (Punjab) to demand the regularisation of work for contract employees. [no size=no report]

On March 2, guest teachers of Delhi government schools continued demonstrating outside the residence of the Education Minister in Delhi-New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) for a second day, demanding regularisation. [size=no report]

On 2 Mar, residents of Watrihal in Budgam district staged a protest at the Press Enclave in Srinagar city (J&K), demanding the establishment of a government degree college in their area. [size=scores]

On 2 Mar, demonstrators diverted traffic on the Srinagar-Charar-e-Sharief road at Chadoora village (Budgam, J&K), amid a shutdown, demanding the establishment of a government degree college in their area. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 2 Mar, in Vijayapura (Vijayapura, Karnataka), the ABVP activists staged a protest at the BLDE Engineering College premises against a professor who made anti-national remarks on social media (Facebook) in relation to the Pulwama attack in J&K. The professor apologized and students made him kneel and plead forgiveness. [size=no report]

On March 2, students from different schools, leaders of District Bar Association and members of different organizations held a rally culminating at a local press club in Mehrabpur town (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh), to express support for the Pakistan Army. [size=no report]
01 March: Bungoma High school students protested against school principal. [size=no report]
On Mar 1, at least three activist of BCL were injured in infighting at Rajshahi university in Rajshahi city over a cricket match. [size=no report]

On March 1, guest teachers of Delhi government schools demonstrated outside the residence of the Education Minister in Delhi-New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) demanding regularisation. The day before, their contract ended and they were not informed if it would be terminated or renewed. [size=no report]

On March 1, over 100 students of Sridev Suman Subharti Medical College demonstrated on the street outside Doon Medical College in Dehradun (Uttarakhand) to oppose the government's decision for them to re-sit their first-year exam. [size= 100]

On March 1, a group of villagers, students and parents staged a protest in front of Government Secondary School in Namunaghar village (South Andaman, Andaman and Nicobar), demanding immediate repairing of school building and also provision of a proper playground. [size=dozens]

On March 1, students continued demonstrating for the third day at the University of Health Sciences in Rohtak (Haryana) and burnt the effigy of the VC to demand hostel facilities and increased stipends. Some students were reportedly dragged and beaten by police and others were detained and later released. [size=no report]
On March 1, students and teachers of the Government Sachal Sarmast Degree College staged a rally in Ranipur town (Khairpur, Sindh), to express support for the Pakistan Armed Forces. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Students (South Africa); EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters
notes: 01 March. Protest action, led by the EFFSC, have been reported at the University of the Free State (UFS). Rubbish have been thrown out of the bins during the protest [size=no report].

assoc_actor_1: MSF: Muslim Students Federation; SFI: Students Federation of India; Muslim Group (India); Students (India); Journalists (India)
notes: On 1 Mar, in Malappuram district (Kerala), MSF activists in Calicut University staged a demonstration against the alleged sidelining of the their members in the ongoing C Zone youth festival. Several (7 police, students, and 3 journalists) were injured in stone-pelting and clashes with the SFI and were admitted to a hospital. MSF were later arrested. [size=no report]
On February 28, university teachers across Niger began observing a 72-hour strike, demanding improved living and working conditions.

28 February. Outsourced workers along with the Workers and Students Forum, disrupted classes at the University of the Free State. The protesters demanded that all jobs should be in-sourced. [Size=no report].

On 28 February 2019, a number of teachers held a protest at the headquarters of the Regional Directorate for Education in Gafsa to voice their demands including the criminalization of violence against teachers and improvement in the status of public schools. [size=no report]

On 28 February 2019, teachers held a protest at the headquarters of the Regional Directorate for Education in El Kef against the procrastination in responding to their demands as well as the deterioration of school infrastructure. [size=no report]
On 28 Feruary 2019, teachers and staff at a primary school in Mateur held a protest to demand an improvement in their working conditions. [size=no report]

25-28 February. Students of Antananarivo University Polytechnic School riot over poor living conditions by blocking RN1, burning tires and making stone blockades outside of the university gate in Vontovorona area of Antananarivo. Gendarmerie fire tear gas, with reports of security forces using rubber bullets and arresting students with some injuries reported to journalists and students. [size=no report]

28-29 February. Students from the University of KwaZulu-Natal blocked Hospital Road, Durban, by burning mattresses and various other items including a fridge. The protest was in response to living conditions at university residences. Police was called onto the scene to disperse the protesting students. [size=no report].

On February 28, students from Istanbul University staged a protest in front of Istanbu courthouse in Sisli, Istanbul for their lecturers sentenced to prison due to having signed the declaration reacting military operations in southeastern Turkey. CHP supported the protest. [size=several dozens]

On Feb 28, at least three activists of BCL were injuring during a clash between two rioting factions of BCL over the annual sports games at Government Haji Mohammad Mohsin College in Chittagong town. Police brought the situation under control. [size=no report]

On February 28, several student bodies demonstrated on campus of the Kurukshetra University at Thanesar (Kurukshetra, Harayan) to demand a meeting with the VC. Some students who tried to forcefully enter the VC office were removed and 44 of them detained by police. [size=no report]

On 28 Feb, in Coimbatore city (Coimbatore, TN), members of the Coimbatore Diocese of the Church of South India (CSI) assaulted one another with iron rods and wooden logs over the appointment of principal to the CSI Boys' Higher Secondary School, injuring a Pastor and Diocese's education wing convener. [size=no report]

Assumed on 28 Feb, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), a group of students from the School of Excellence in Law (SOEL) clashed after a heated argument erupted during a bid to settle a feud that had emerged a few months ago. No further information was provided. [size=no report]

On 28 Feb, students staged a protest at the Government Medical College (GMC) in Srinagar city (J&K) against earlier mob violence targeting Kashmiri and Muslim students at the Government Medical College (GMC) Jammu hostel. [size=scores]

On February 28, 10 members of the Congress' student wing NSUI staged a protest in ITI College in Agartala city (West Tripura, Tripura), demanding the suspension of an instructor. They also complained about the condition of classrooms and irregularities in classes. [size=10]

On 28 Feb, in Tondiarpet village (Chennai, TN), parents of private school students staged a road roko ("obstruct the road") near their school alleging that the school management had made false promises regarding its CBSE affiliation. The police detained a few parents. [size=no report]
On February 28, unidentified armed men shot dead a government primary school teacher near the district headquarters hospital in Karak town (Karak, KP).

On February 28, police personnel dispersed local villagers who blocked a road and attempted to torch a bus during a demonstration near Hattar Industrial Estate in Haripur city (Haripur, KP), against the death of a schoolboy after falling from a bus. [size=no report]

On February 28, students of Government Girls College Ayub Colony staged a rally in Faisalabad city (Faisalabad, Punjab), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=no report]

On February 28, students of the Peshawar University, local traders and minority community held various rallies in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=hundreds]

On February 28, students, teachers, activists of various political parties and civil society participated in a rally held by Federal Urdu University of Arts, Science and Technology (FUUAST) in Karachi city (Karachi, Sindh), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=large]

On February 28, teachers and students of Government Degree College Naseerabad held a rally culminating at a local press club in Naseerabad town (Nasirabad, Balochistan), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=no report]

On February 28, students, faculty and staffs of Shah Abdul Latif University along with representatives of SALUTA staged a rally in Khairpur city (Khairpur, Sindh), to express solidarity with the Pakistani armed forces. [size=no report]

On February 28, Punjab University students, teachers and officials staged a rally in Iqbal town (Lahore, Punjab), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=no report]

The protest was in response to NSFAS allowances not being paid and tuition and postgraduate registration fee increases. The Economic Freedom Fighters Student Command and the South African Students' Congress led the protests.

assoc_actor_1: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union; Labour Group (South Africa)
notes: 15 February. Workers at the Msunduzi and Midlands TVET Colleges protested at the Msunduzi campus, led by the National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union (NEHAWU). Reports of tires burnt and people prevented from entering schools. Workers demand full time employment. Workers said that nine of their members were shot by police.

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On February 15, Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad activists students bunrt effigies in front of Lumding college is Lumding city (Hojai, Assam), in protest against the attack by Pakistan-backed militants in Kashmir's Pulwama district, on February 14. [size = no report]

On February 15, locals, teachers and parents staged a protest demonstration in front of Catholic School, in Canchipur area of Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur), against the planting an IED at the gate of the school on February 14. The bomb was safely disposed by the bomb detection and disposal squad. [size = no report]

On February 15, around 30 students beat up another student from the National Institute of Technology (NIT) inside the college hostel in Durgapur city (Paschim Bardhaman, West Bengal), over a social media post about the attack by Pakistan-backed militants in Kashmir's Pulwama district, on February 14.

On 15 Feb, in Bhopal city (Bhopal, MP), students of the MP School of Drama marched to the chief minister's residence to protest and demand solutions to the inconveniences they are facing because of shortage of funds. They called off their protest on 16 Feb. [size=no report]

On 15 Feb, in Bengaluru city (Bengaluru Urban, Karnataka), three Kashmiri students beat up a fellow collegemate (Koushik Debnath) when the latter questioned their social media (Facebook) post supporting the Pulwama attack in J&K. The 3 were later arrested on charges of assault and spreading of hateful messages on social media.

On 15 Feb, 3,000 students of Government College for Girls in Sector 14 took out a march from the college to minister Rao Narbir Singh's residence in Gurgaon (Haryana). They were protesting the militant attack on a CRPF convoy at Pulwama in Jammu and Kashmir. [size=around 3000]

On Feb. 15 2019, a group called Anarchists damaged several glass panes and desks at the ELTA (post office) branch in the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki campus just after opening time and then fled. They claimed responsibility on Feb. 22 and expressed their solidarity with a jailed robber with suspected ties with urban guerrilla groups, who has been on hunger strike for more than a month.

On February 15, 2019 in Bar, Montenegro, citizens held a protest over the construction of a kindergarten in the backyard of a high school, which the police dispersed, violently removing a pregnant woman from the site of the protest, after which she lost the baby. Citizens continued the protest in the afternoon, and later in the night, turning it into a protest against police brutality.

On 14 Feb, in Vijayawada (Krishna, AP), unaided teaching, non-teaching staff, and students of the Maris Stella College staged a protest at the college campus to demand that the government cancel GO No 35 and protect the private aided colleges. Protest still ongoing as of 18 Feb. Day 1

assoc_actor_1: COSAS: Congress of South African Students; Students (South Africa)
notes: 14 February. Congress of South African Students (Cosas) protested outside the Sans Souci Girls' High School, showing support for a student who was slapped by a teacher after the student pushed her desk against the teacher.
On Feb 14th, students at Hillside Teachers' College in Bulawayo staged a peaceful demonstration against the hiking of boarding fees.

On Feb 14 2019, clashes broke out between Israeli forces and Palestinian students in Hebron City near the Tariq ibn Ziyad school, as Israeli forces stormed the area. Dozens of Palestinian students suffered from tear-gas inhalation.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)

On Feb 14, Pragatisheel Chhatra Jote student activists staged a protest at Dhaka University (Shahbagh, Dhaka) and demanded setting up of polling stations at academic building instead of residential halls.

On 14 Feb, members of the Guru Nanak Dev University Employees Association held a protest in Amritsar city (Punjab) against the university authorities for not releasing the wages according to the 6th pay commission recommendations.

On 14 Feb, in Vijayawada (Krishna, AP), unaided staff and faculty members, including students and the Stella Mary College Unaided Association Santhi Sree, boycotted classes and participated in a protest demanding that the government cancel GO No 35 and protect the private aided colleges. Day 5. [size=no report]

Student groups like UP Solidaridad held a protest against the arrest of Maria Ressa, a prominent journalist, at the University of the Philippines Diliman in Quezon City, Metro Manila on February 14, 2019. They criticized the administration for clamping down on press freedom. [size= no report]

Student groups like the College Editors Guild of the Philippines held a protest against the arrest of Maria Ressa, a prominent journalist, at the University of the Philippines Cebu in Cebu City, Cebu province on February 14, 2019. They criticized the administration for clamping down on press freedom. [size= no report]

assoc_actor_1: Students (Philippines); Anakbayan; LFS: League of Filipino Students

On the same day, student groups like League of Filipino Students and Anakbayan held a similar protest at the University of Santo Tomas in Manila, Metro Manila. As well, student groups held another protest at the Polytechnic University of the Philippines in Manila, Metro Manila. [size=no report]
On February 14, 2019 in Bar, Montenegro, the police dispersed a protest over the construction of a kindergarten in the backyard of a local high school, arresting five people.

assoc_actor_1: LDPR: Liberal Democratic Party of Russia
notes: On February 14, 2019, around 30 people took part in a protest organized by the local branch of LDPR, calling for Alexander Petritskiy, head of the city's department of education, to step down following complaints of low availability of spots in local schools and kindergartens. No incidents were reported.
On 13 February, 2019, Students at a professional school organized a protest in Tizi Ouzou "denouncing bad working conditions".

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On February 13, presumed Katiba Macina or Ansaroul Islam (JNIM) militants ransacked the school in the village of Nomo and seized the supply of rice from the cantine.
13 February (on or before). Disarmed Nsapu militia members occupied the Kamako primary school and imposed taxes and arbitrary arrests on the civilian population in Kamako.
13 February. Pastoralist militia attacked a Technical Secondary School in Afa, killed one person and abducted a Catholic cleric.
On Feb 13, two armed groups of BCL activists clashed at Jahangirnagar University (Savar, Dhaka) following a previous enmity. Eight people were injured in the clash.
On Feb 13, a protest was held by students following the HDNE courses in front of University Grants Commission in Colombo city. (The reason for the protest was not mentioned in the source text.)

On Feb 13, villagers held a protest outside Kurunegala Vishwoda National School in Kurunegala town and blocked the local road, on the day the Prime Minister was coming to attend an event. The protestors said that the new school that had opened had refused to admit students from neighbouring areas.
On 13 Feb, between 12 and 28 school students were injured in an explosion at the Falai-e-Millat school in Narbal village (Pulwama, J&K).
On 13 Feb, local youths pelted policemen with stones at Narbal village (Pulwama, J&K) as the attempted to reach the site of an explosion at Falai-e-Millat school. Police responded with tear gas.

Assumed on 13 Feb, in Bhimavaram town (West Godavari, AP), students and people's organisations staged demonstration in the town to condemn the rape of a 10-year-old school girl of Sri Bharathi School. Day 1

On 13 Feb, on the outskirts of Coimbatore city (Coimbatore, TN), students of Sree Narayana Guru College staged a protest on the campus demanding action against an assistant professor who allegedly harassed two girls.
On 13 Feb, students staged a protest at Kashmir University in Srinagar city (J&K) against the decision by staff to strike in support of a JRL shutdown against moves to abrogate Article 35A.
On 13 Feb, students at MR College in Fazilka (Punjab) staged a protest against the fee demanded by the college management from the Scheduled Caste students.

On 13 Feb, members of the Punjab Students' Union (PSU) staged a protest outside Government Rajindra College in Bathinda town (Punjab). They were protesting the cane-charge on protesting teachers in Patiala.

On 13 Feb, Aligarh Muslim University students boycotted classes and staged a protest at the Bab-eSyed Gate of the university in Aligarh (UP) to raise their voice against sedition charges against 14 accused.

On February 13, students and teachers from the North Eastern Hill University took out a protest march on the premises in Shillong city (East Khasi Hills, Meghalaya), against the Citizenship Amendment Bill.

On February 13, students of Federal Urdu University of Science and Technology staged a protest in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory), against university's management for increasing fees.
On February 13, few locals assaulted teachers of a secondary school in Ishworpur Municipality (Sarlahi district, Janakpur).

On Feb 12, in Bonon, a group of students protested against professors' strike, which has been interrupting public school for three weeks. Students set up barricades on the main road. Police Forces clashed with the protesters, and used tear gas. Students reportedly threw stones at them. One police officer was injured.
12 February. Learners from Nooitgedacht Primary School, Cape Town, protested against gang violence in the area. The protest was organised by Bishop Lavis Action Community (BLAC).

12 February. Ehlanzeni Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) College students marched to protest the exclusion of students from the National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) funding.
12 February. Students from Cape Peninsula University of Technology, Bellville campus, built shacks on the campus and set fire to buses in protest against accommodation shortages.

On Feb 12 2019, Israeli forces raided the town of Abu Dis in Al Quds and sealed off roads near Al-Quds University. This triggered clashes with Palestinian youth, to which Israeli forces responded by firing rubber bullets and teargas canisters. At least 17 Palestinians were treated from tear gas inhalation.

On Feb 12 2019, 17 Palestinian students suffered from tear-gas inhalation after Israeli forces stormed the Al-Quds University in Abu Dis while classes were ongoing. Israeli forces also fired stun grenades at the students.
On Feb 12 2019, Israeli forces detained and assaulted two Palestinian students on their way to school in Jabal al Tawil in Ramallah.

On 12 Feb, BJP members were assaulted by Aligarh Muslim University students in Aligarh (UP) when they were demanding cancellation of a proposed visit of MIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi to the campus. Report indicates the students were from the Muslim community.

On 12 Feb, students staged a protest at the government degree college in Samba district town (J&K) against stranded Kashmir-bound passengers who allegedly raised anti-India slogans and police who intervened against rival rioting students.

assoc_actor_1: Students (India); ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; JJSF: Jammu Justice Secular Forum
notes: On 12 Feb, ABVP and JJSF led student protests at various college campuses in Jammu city (J&K) against stranded Kashmir-bound passengers who allegedly raised anti-India slogans and police who intervened against rival rioting students.

On 12 Feb, teachers and students protested and raised slogans on campus in New Delhi against the Jawaharlal Nehru University's academic council for adopting a government notification on reservation for economically weaker sections.

On February 12, a group assaulted a student with khukuri at the gate of his school in Tulsipur city (Dang district, Rapti). The student sustained serious injuries as a result of the incident and is currently undergoing treatment.

On February 12, students of the Postgraduate College, Samanabad, staged a protest at Samanabad Road in Faisalabad city (Faisalabad, Punjab), against kite flying and demanded stern action against those involved in kite manufacturing and flying.

As reported on February 12, students and teachers of a school in Aroop area staged a protest in front of Deputy Commissioner's office in Gujranwala city (Gujranwala, Punjab), against WASA authorities over poor sewerage condition in front of their school.

On February 11, dozens of students protested in front of the rectorate of N'Djamena university, the police fired warning shots to prevent the students from entering, and also arrested around ten students.

On Feb 11, in Guiglo, a group of students protested against professors' strike, which has been interrupting public school for three weeks. Students set up barricades and destroyed several statues. Police Forces interfered, using tear gas. One student was injured.

On Feb 11, in Botro, a group of highschool students protesting against the interruption of public school following professors' strike tried to interrupt courses in the Mayor's private school and to force students to leave their classrooms. Police forces clashed with the students and allegedly beat one of them and arrested 11.

On Feb 11, in the morning, public school students (Nangui Abrogoua highschool, Williamsville highschool, and Harris highschool) attempted to interrupt courses in Djedji Amondji Pierre highschool, throwing stones, bottles and sticks at the students, injuring 3 of them and forcing them to leave their classrooms. They were protesting against the interruption of public school following professors' strike since three weeks. Police Forces interfered, using tear gas to disperse the rioters.

On Feb 11, a group of students, protesting against the interruption of public school following a professors' strike, attempted to interrupt courses and force students of Nangui Abrogoua highschool to leave their classrooms, in Abidjan.

On Feb 11, Alepe Modern highschool students protested against the interruption of public school following an ongoing professors' strike. They threw stones at students from other schools, forcing them to leave their classrooms.

On Feb 11, in Soubre, students from several highschools protested against the interruption of public school following an ongoing professors' strike. They interrupted courses in Charles Bauza Donwahi private highschool, Modern 1 private highschool, Modern 2 private highschool and Bernard Zadi Zaourou private highschool, forcing the students to leave their classrooms.

11 February. The main entrance of the Vaal University of Technology (VUT) was blocked by protesting students over financial exclusion and the non-payment of allowances by the National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS). Students also protested at their residences over the shortage of accommodation. Stones and bottles were thrown by student to gain entrance to the residence. Police used rubber bullets to diffuse the riot.

assoc_actor_1: SASCO: South Africa Students Congress; Students (South Africa)
notes: 11 January. Students from University of South Africa protested in Langalibalele Street, Pietermaritzburg, burning tyres and refuse, over the National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) not paying allowances and tuition fees. The protest was led by the South African Students Congress (SASCO).

assoc_actor_1: EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command; Students (South Africa)
notes: 11 February. Students from Tshwane University of Technology, led by the EFFSC, protested at Ga-Rankuwa, Arcadia and at the campus in Pretoria West, demanding management to deal with National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) funding. They burnt tyres at the entrances of the campuses
University students in Idleb city protested for the second day the closure of the university by HTS after the public did not allow the latter to run it.

On Feb 11 2019, a demonstration was held in front of the Ministry of Education in Beirut as a result from the suicide of George Zureik earlier this month. Zureik lit himself on fire in protest against rising school fees in front of his daughter's school and he died of his wounds.

On February 11, students from Mission Blind School, Heikakpokpi, blocked the Imphal-Moreh highway by putting benches across it, at Heikakpokpi village (Chandel, Manipur). They claimed the school was not getting any assistance from the State Government.

On 11 Feb, GGM Science College students clashed with Kashmiri passengers stranded by road closures in Jammu city (J&K). The clash occurred after some Kashmiri passengers raised pro-Pakistan slogans over the administrations failure to airlift them to Srinagar. Police intervened with a lathicharge against the students.

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 11 Feb, in Chitradurga district (Karnataka), members of ABVP staged a protest demanding the Davanagere University administration to make necessary changes on certain issues in the Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) scheme.

On 11 Feb, commercial vehicle drivers took out a protest in the streets on Meewat district (Haryana) demanding the renewal of their licences. The government has demanded school certificates as requirement, resulting in the non-renewal of a number licences.

On February 11, students of Dibrugarh University staged a protest in Dibrugarh city (Dibrugarh, Assam), against the Citizenship Amendment Bill. They cut their fingers and wrote slogans on placards with their blood.

On 11 Feb, in Bhopal city (Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh), students of the Makhanlal Chaturvedi National University of Journalism and Mass Communication staged a protest against the irregularities in student evaluation. Students locked the gate to prevent the police from entering the campus. Some students had to jump from the gate to enter.

On 11 Feb, students staged a march from their accommodation in the Sainik colony area of Jammu city (J&K) to the CUJ campus in Bagla, Samba. The protest was held in response to the university's decision to cancel a bus service after students refused to pay a newly enacted monthly bus fare.

On 11 Feb, in Azad Maidan (Mumbai City, Maha), about 100 teachers from private-aided schools staged a protest condemning lack of subsidies to private-aided schools. Protest still ongoing as of 13 Feb. Day 1
On 11 Feb, in Chennai town (Chennai, TN), teaching fellows of the Anna University staged a protest near the main gate of the campus demanding regularisation of their service.

On 11 Feb, in Hyderabad (Hyderabad, Telangana), parents, including Mothers Association for Quality Education and Child Rights Protection Forum, staged a protest in front of the collectorate office demanding that the state government to establish an autonomous commission to monitor learning outcomes of school children.

On 11 Feb, in Rangareddy district (Telangana), parents, including Mothers Association for Quality Education and Child Rights Protection Forum, staged a protest in front of the collectorate office demanding that the state government to establish an autonomous commission to monitor learning outcomes of school children.

On 11 Feb, parents of students studying in Government Adarsh Senior Secondary School in Bathida city held a protest outside the school against the decision of changing the board from the Central Board of Secondary Education to the Punjab School Education Board.
On February 11, different organizations, students and teachers of different schools staged a protest in Golarchi town (Badin, Sindh), against shortage of water in Imam Wah.

On Feb. 11, 2019: Students from the Law Faculty in Tirana, who stayed barricaded in their university until this day, said they were ending their boycott, thus allowing the teaching process to take place. One of the students explained that the decision was taken because exams were approaching and they did not want to lose the academic year. Other students said the group will continue to seek education reform.

On Feb. 11 2019, students of the Technological Educational Institute of Western Macedonia in Kozani occupied the administration offices in protest to the possibility of merging with the University of Western Macedonia, which they believe would mean that all premises would have to be moved to the city of Grevena, where the University is based.
On Feb 10, in Beni Suef, in the Fourth neighborhood, a group of students from the Japanese school protested in front of the school against the rise of school fees.
University students in Idleb city protested the closure of the university by HTS after the public did not allow the latter to run it.

source: Palestinian News Network; Ma'an News Agency; Jordan News Agency
